CONJUGATES: more wonderful | most wonderful | wonderfully (adv) | wonder (n/v)
ETYMOLOGY: Compound of Old English wundor ('wonder') and the suffix -ful ('full of')

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Extremely good, pleasant, or satisfying; inspiring delight or admiration.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 极好的；精彩的；美妙的；令人愉悦的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We had a wonderful vacation in Italy last summer.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 去年夏天我们在意大利度过了一个美妙的假期。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Causing astonishment or admiration; miraculous or extraordinary.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 令人惊奇的；不可思议的；充满奇迹的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The scientist observed the wonderful complexity of the human cell.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 科学家观察到了人类细胞令人惊叹的复杂性。
